you mean you want to assign an additional IP address to a NIC?
you create an alias.  such as:   ifconfig eth0:1 192.168.123.111 netmask 255.255.255.0
that creates an IP for eth0, in addition to whatever eth0's "real" IP is.
you have a default route to the gateway, it applies to all interfaces.
you don't need a default route for each interface.  If you have two NICs, say, or as here one nic with two IPs, you still only need one default route.
